title: How can I force stop all apps at once on Android?
content:
Close all apps: Swipe up from the bottom, hold, then let go. Swipe from left to right. On the left, tap Clear all. Close all apps on Android Go: Swipe up from the bottom, hold, and let go.

Apk Factor

I have currently multiple opened tabs, and it's impossible to navigate, to open a new tab, a new window, to interact in any way. When I go to the top left under meny -Firefox - About Firefox - Submit Feedback or Firefox Help, a new tab does open, but I still cannot interact with it. I have to quit and reopen multiple times (third today) for it to work properly. Please help! Many thanks

title: Device specific sync settings on same account?
content: Hi, I'm using my personal Firefox account at work, but would like to only sync passwords and open tabs. When I change the sync settings in Firefox at the work computer, the corresponding sync settings are also applied to my private devices (Windows PC, Android tablet and phone), meaning my bookmarks, history and everything isn't synced between my private devices. However, I'd like to keep synchronization on for everything on all private devices, just not for the work pc except for passwords and open tabs. Isn't there a way to have device specific synchronization settings when logged into the same account? Or is it that whenever I change which items to sync, it gets applied to my Firefox account and therefore is applied to all devices I'm logged in? Sorry if I worded it weirdly, let me know if there's something hard to understand in my text. Thank you!
creator: maria_99

title: Very long "Waiting to transmit the response" times shown in profiler
content:
Hi,

I encountered an issue where I was getting really slow performance from a server, and I ruled out the server's query as being the issue. I ran the performance profiler, and I found that virtually all of the time was spent in the "Waiting to transmit the response" phase, found in the Network tab of the profile, when hovering over a long bar. In many cases, it was taking over 15 seconds, and there wasn't much information at all being sent from the server.

My question is, what exactly does that phase of the request cover? Could it involve the server not sending data fast enough? A network issue (DNS, proxies, etc.)? The client being low on resources at that moment?

Also, can someone please provide me a list of possible other areas of the profile, or anywhere else, to check to help me narrow down the cause of slow performance in this specific area?

Thanks!
creator: jmyszka
